node.display_long_description:
vSpatial brings your workspace to the Quest

Surround yourself with unlimited monitors and jump into focus mode. Access your favorite browser, professional working/ design tools, and music streaming apps in VR. vSpatial supports all Windows 10 apps and is already integrated into professional businesses today.

PRODUCTIVITY (On virtual steroids)
Multi-task by surrounding yourself with a ring of multiple apps and windows to see everything you’re working on at once
Resize and isolate apps
Safe and secure remote desktop
Bluetooth mouse and keyboard support
Take a break with basketball

COLLABORATION (With your team)
Seamlessly bring your team into your workspace with Collaboration Pro
Work together by sharing multiple app screens
Let your contacts join your space with avatars to share and draw on whatever screens/ apps you want
Crystal clear spatial audio to distinguish teammates

node.reviewDescription:
I just got started with vSpatial and have to say I am impressed. My office has never looked so good and clutter-free! No cords, no papers, no I’ll-get-to-it-later piles. Nothing but screens. I love it.

I had my work-mood tunes playing on my computer when I first connected to it. Almost immediately, the music automatically switched to playing thru my headset. For a brief moment, the surprise made me think I had been transported to that VR office. I had to chuckle.

This solution delivers in making a remote VR connection to your computer(s) a breeze and an environment you can get pampered with. The biggest problem I had was struggling to find the at-symbol (@) on the virtual keyboard to sign into my new account. Hint: press the shift key for special characters! Another hint: if you have trouble with using the trigger to press virtual keys, try the A/X button on your remote.

I've been writing the Product Developer. He had an answer or solution-pending for all of the minor issues I could point-out. If you're considering this app for a VR remote connection solution, do try it. You won't regret it.

Gilliosa, regarding your enhancement requests: 

(1) Hand tracking - I agree, this would be great. Given the precision loss, I don't see it as useful enough yet though. I'd rather see the technology mature first. But, eventual integration is inevitable.

(2) Additional carousels - I think you are wanting carousel sets, the ability to pull down a set of apps/connections, just like you would an individual app. Intriguing thought. I like it.

(3) Multiple full screens - You might be missing the point of "full" screen. Simply allowing a bigger carousel might be what you are really after.

(4) and (5) Mouse right-click and ...physical keyboard - You can use a real mouse and keyboard connected by Bluetooth/USB, although you might have to sneak peek at your keyboard every now and then.

(5) VR/AR keyboard - Stay tuned, friend. That wish may be closer to coming true than you think.
node.reviewTitle: Ignore Your Desk and Get to Work

website_page_meta.description: vSpatial brings your workspace to the Quest. Surround yourself with unlimited monitors and jump into focus mode. Access your favorite browser, professional working tools, music streaming apps, and design tools in VR. vSpatial supports all Windows 10 apps. Used by business professionals internationally, ditch your limited monitor with its tiny application windows for a carousel of virtual monitors to best visualize your work.
website_page_meta.title: vSpatial · Oculus Quest
